00037 #include "socklnd.h"
00038 
00039 int
00040 ksocknal_lib_get_conn_addrs (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00041 {
00042         int rc = lnet_sock_getaddr(conn->ksnc_sock, true,
00043                                      &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
00044                                      &conn->ksnc_port);
00045 
00046         /* Didn't need the {get,put}connsock dance to deref ksnc_sock... */
00047         LASSERT (!conn->ksnc_closing);
00048 
00049         if (rc != 0) {
00050                 CERROR ("Error %d getting sock peer IP\n", rc);
00051                 return rc;
00052         }
00053 
00054         rc = lnet_sock_getaddr(conn->ksnc_sock, false,
00055                                  &conn->ksnc_myipaddr, NULL);
00056         if (rc != 0) {
00057                 CERROR ("Error %d getting sock local IP\n", rc);
00058                 return rc;
00059         }
00060 
00061         return 0;
00062 }
00063 
00064 int
00065 ksocknal_lib_zc_capable(ksock_conn_t *conn)
00066 {
00067         int  caps = conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_route_caps;
00068 
00069         if (conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v1x)
00070                 return 0;
00071 
00072         /* ZC if the socket supports scatter/gather and doesn't need software
00073          * checksums */
00074         return ((caps & NETIF_F_SG) != 0 && (caps & NETIF_F_ALL_CSUM) != 0);
00075 }
00076 
00077 int
00078 ksocknal_lib_send_iov(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00079 {
00080         struct socket  *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00081         int             nob;
00082         int             rc;
00083 
00084         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_enable_csum        && /* checksum enabled */
00085             conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v2x && /* V2.x connection  */
00086             tx->tx_nob == tx->tx_resid                 && /* frist sending    */
00087             tx->tx_msg.ksm_csum == 0)                     /* not checksummed  */
00088                 ksocknal_lib_csum_tx(tx);
00089 
00090         /* NB we can't trust socket ops to either consume our iovs
00091          * or leave them alone. */
00092 
00093         {
00094 #if SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_TX
00095                 struct kvec scratch;
00096                 struct kvec *scratchiov = &scratch;
00097                 unsigned int niov = 1;
00098 #else
00099                 struct kvec *scratchiov = conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_scratch_iov;
00100                 unsigned int niov = tx->tx_niov;
00101 #endif
00102                 struct msghdr msg = { .msg_flags = MSG_DONTWAIT };
00103                 int  i;
00104 
00105                 for (nob = i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00106                         scratchiov[i] = tx->tx_iov[i];
00107                         nob += scratchiov[i].iov_len;
00108                 }
00109 
00110                 if (!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue) ||
00111                     nob < tx->tx_resid)
00112                         msg.msg_flags |= MSG_MORE;
00113 
00114                 rc = kernel_sendmsg(sock, &msg, scratchiov, niov, nob);
00115         }
00116         return rc;
00117 }
00118 
00119 int
00120 ksocknal_lib_send_kiov(ksock_conn_t *conn, ksock_tx_t *tx)
00121 {
00122         struct socket *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00123         lnet_kiov_t   *kiov = tx->tx_kiov;
00124         int            rc;
00125         int            nob;
00126 
00127         /* Not NOOP message */
00128         LASSERT (tx->tx_lnetmsg != NULL);
00129 
00130         /* NB we can't trust socket ops to either consume our iovs
00131          * or leave them alone. */
00132         if (tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] != 0) {
00133                 /* Zero copy is enabled */
00134                 struct sock   *sk = sock->sk;
00135                 struct page   *page = kiov->kiov_page;
00136                 int            offset = kiov->kiov_offset;
00137                 int            fragsize = kiov->kiov_len;
00138                 int            msgflg = MSG_DONTWAIT;
00139 
00140                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "page %p + offset %x for %d\n",
00141                                page, offset, kiov->kiov_len);
00142 
00143                 if (!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue) ||
00144                     fragsize < tx->tx_resid)
00145                         msgflg |= MSG_MORE;
00146 
00147                 if (sk->sk_prot->sendpage != NULL) {
00148                         rc = sk->sk_prot->sendpage(sk, page,
00149                                                    offset, fragsize, msgflg);
00150                 } else {
00151                         rc = cfs_tcp_sendpage(sk, page, offset, fragsize,
00152                                               msgflg);
00153                 }
00154         } else {
00155 #if SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_TX || !SOCKNAL_RISK_KMAP_DEADLOCK
00156                 struct kvec     scratch;
00157                 struct kvec   *scratchiov = &scratch;
00158                 unsigned int    niov = 1;
00159 #else
00160 #ifdef CONFIG_HIGHMEM
00161 #warning "XXX risk of kmap deadlock on multiple frags..."
00162 #endif
00163                 struct kvec *scratchiov = conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_scratch_iov;
00164                 unsigned int  niov = tx->tx_nkiov;
00165 #endif
00166                 struct msghdr msg = { .msg_flags = MSG_DONTWAIT };
00167                 int           i;
00168 
00169                 for (nob = i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00170                         scratchiov[i].iov_base = kmap(kiov[i].kiov_page) +
00171                                                  kiov[i].kiov_offset;
00172                         nob += scratchiov[i].iov_len = kiov[i].kiov_len;
00173                 }
00174 
00175                 if (!list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue) ||
00176                     nob < tx->tx_resid)
00177                         msg.msg_flags |= MSG_MORE;
00178 
00179                 rc = kernel_sendmsg(sock, &msg, scratchiov, niov, nob);
00180 
00181                 for (i = 0; i < niov; i++)
00182                         kunmap(kiov[i].kiov_page);
00183         }
00184         return rc;
00185 }
00186 
00187 void
00188 ksocknal_lib_eager_ack (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00189 {
00190         int            opt = 1;
00191         struct socket *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00192 
00193         /* Remind the socket to ACK eagerly.  If I don't, the socket might
00194          * think I'm about to send something it could piggy-back the ACK
00195          * on, introducing delay in completing zero-copy sends in my
00196          * peer. */
00197 
00198         kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_QUICKACK,
00199                           (char *)&opt, sizeof(opt));
00200 }
00201 
00202 int
00203 ksocknal_lib_recv_iov (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00204 {
00205 #if SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_RX
00206         struct kvec  scratch;
00207         struct kvec *scratchiov = &scratch;
00208         unsigned int  niov = 1;
00209 #else
00210         struct kvec *scratchiov = conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_scratch_iov;
00211         unsigned int  niov = conn->ksnc_rx_niov;
00212 #endif
00213         struct kvec *iov = conn->ksnc_rx_iov;
00214         struct msghdr msg = {
00215                 .msg_flags      = 0
00216         };
00217         int          nob;
00218         int          i;
00219         int          rc;
00220         int          fragnob;
00221         int          sum;
00222         __u32        saved_csum;
00223 
00224         /* NB we can't trust socket ops to either consume our iovs
00225          * or leave them alone. */
00226         LASSERT (niov > 0);
00227 
00228         for (nob = i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00229                 scratchiov[i] = iov[i];
00230                 nob += scratchiov[i].iov_len;
00231         }
00232         LASSERT (nob <= conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted);
00233 
00234         rc = kernel_recvmsg(conn->ksnc_sock, &msg, scratchiov, niov, nob,
00235                             MSG_DONTWAIT);
00236 
00237         saved_csum = 0;
00238         if (conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v2x) {
00239                 saved_csum = conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum;
00240                 conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum = 0;
00241         }
00242 
00243         if (saved_csum != 0) {
00244                 /* accumulate checksum */
00245                 for (i = 0, sum = rc; sum > 0; i++, sum -= fragnob) {
00246                         LASSERT (i < niov);
00247 
00248                         fragnob = iov[i].iov_len;
00249                         if (fragnob > sum)
00250                                 fragnob = sum;
00251 
00252                         conn->ksnc_rx_csum = ksocknal_csum(conn->ksnc_rx_csum,
00253                                                            iov[i].iov_base, fragnob);
00254                 }
00255                 conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum = saved_csum;
00256         }
00257 
00258         return rc;
00259 }
00260 
00261 static void
00262 ksocknal_lib_kiov_vunmap(void *addr)
00263 {
00264         if (addr == NULL)
00265                 return;
00266 
00267         vunmap(addr);
00268 }
00269 
00270 static void *
00271 ksocknal_lib_kiov_vmap(lnet_kiov_t *kiov, int niov,
00272                        struct kvec *iov, struct page **pages)
00273 {
00274         void             *addr;
00275         int               nob;
00276         int               i;
00277 
00278         if (!*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_zc_recv || pages == NULL)
00279                 return NULL;
00280 
00281         LASSERT (niov <= LNET_MAX_IOV);
00282 
00283         if (niov < 2 ||
00284             niov < *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_zc_recv_min_nfrags)
00285                 return NULL;
00286 
00287         for (nob = i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00288                 if ((kiov[i].kiov_offset != 0 && i > 0) ||
00289                     (kiov[i].kiov_offset + kiov[i].kiov_len !=
00290                      PAGE_CACHE_SIZE && i < niov - 1))
00291                         return NULL;
00292 
00293                 pages[i] = kiov[i].kiov_page;
00294                 nob += kiov[i].kiov_len;
00295         }
00296 
00297         addr = vmap(pages, niov, VM_MAP, PAGE_KERNEL);
00298         if (addr == NULL)
00299                 return NULL;
00300 
00301         iov->iov_base = addr + kiov[0].kiov_offset;
00302         iov->iov_len = nob;
00303 
00304         return addr;
00305 }
00306 
00307 int
00308 ksocknal_lib_recv_kiov (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00309 {
00310 #if SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_RX || !SOCKNAL_RISK_KMAP_DEADLOCK
00311         struct kvec   scratch;
00312         struct kvec  *scratchiov = &scratch;
00313         struct page  **pages      = NULL;
00314         unsigned int   niov       = 1;
00315 #else
00316 #ifdef CONFIG_HIGHMEM
00317 #warning "XXX risk of kmap deadlock on multiple frags..."
00318 #endif
00319         struct kvec  *scratchiov = conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_scratch_iov;
00320         struct page  **pages      = conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_rx_scratch_pgs;
00321         unsigned int   niov       = conn->ksnc_rx_nkiov;
00322 #endif
00323         lnet_kiov_t   *kiov = conn->ksnc_rx_kiov;
00324         struct msghdr msg = {
00325                 .msg_flags      = 0
00326         };
00327         int          nob;
00328         int          i;
00329         int          rc;
00330         void        *base;
00331         void        *addr;
00332         int          sum;
00333         int          fragnob;
00334         int n;
00335 
00336         /* NB we can't trust socket ops to either consume our iovs
00337          * or leave them alone. */
00338         if ((addr = ksocknal_lib_kiov_vmap(kiov, niov, scratchiov, pages)) != NULL) {
00339                 nob = scratchiov[0].iov_len;
00340                 n = 1;
00341 
00342         } else {
00343                 for (nob = i = 0; i < niov; i++) {
00344                         nob += scratchiov[i].iov_len = kiov[i].kiov_len;
00345                         scratchiov[i].iov_base = kmap(kiov[i].kiov_page) +
00346                                                  kiov[i].kiov_offset;
00347                 }
00348                 n = niov;
00349         }
00350 
00351         LASSERT (nob <= conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted);
00352 
00353         rc = kernel_recvmsg(conn->ksnc_sock, &msg, scratchiov, n, nob,
00354                             MSG_DONTWAIT);
00355 
00356         if (conn->ksnc_msg.ksm_csum != 0) {
00357                 for (i = 0, sum = rc; sum > 0; i++, sum -= fragnob) {
00358                         LASSERT (i < niov);
00359 
00360                         /* Dang! have to kmap again because I have nowhere to stash the
00361                          * mapped address.  But by doing it while the page is still
00362                          * mapped, the kernel just bumps the map count and returns me
00363                          * the address it stashed. */
00364                         base = kmap(kiov[i].kiov_page) + kiov[i].kiov_offset;
00365                         fragnob = kiov[i].kiov_len;
00366                         if (fragnob > sum)
00367                                 fragnob = sum;
00368 
00369                         conn->ksnc_rx_csum = ksocknal_csum(conn->ksnc_rx_csum,
00370                                                            base, fragnob);
00371 
00372                         kunmap(kiov[i].kiov_page);
00373                 }
00374         }
00375 
00376         if (addr != NULL) {
00377                 ksocknal_lib_kiov_vunmap(addr);
00378         } else {
00379                 for (i = 0; i < niov; i++)
00380                         kunmap(kiov[i].kiov_page);
00381         }
00382 
00383         return (rc);
00384 }
00385 
00386 void
00387 ksocknal_lib_csum_tx(ksock_tx_t *tx)
00388 {
00389         int          i;
00390         __u32        csum;
00391         void        *base;
00392 
00393         LASSERT(tx->tx_iov[0].iov_base == (void *)&tx->tx_msg);
00394         LASSERT(tx->tx_conn != NULL);
00395         LASSERT(tx->tx_conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v2x);
00396 
00397         tx->tx_msg.ksm_csum = 0;
00398 
00399         csum = ksocknal_csum(~0, (void *)tx->tx_iov[0].iov_base,
00400                              tx->tx_iov[0].iov_len);
00401 
00402         if (tx->tx_kiov != NULL) {
00403                 for (i = 0; i < tx->tx_nkiov; i++) {
00404                         base = kmap(tx->tx_kiov[i].kiov_page) +
00405                                tx->tx_kiov[i].kiov_offset;
00406 
00407                         csum = ksocknal_csum(csum, base, tx->tx_kiov[i].kiov_len);
00408 
00409                         kunmap(tx->tx_kiov[i].kiov_page);
00410                 }
00411         } else {
00412                 for (i = 1; i < tx->tx_niov; i++)
00413                         csum = ksocknal_csum(csum, tx->tx_iov[i].iov_base,
00414                                              tx->tx_iov[i].iov_len);
00415         }
00416 
00417         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_inject_csum_error) {
00418                 csum++;
00419                 *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_inject_csum_error = 0;
00420         }
00421 
00422         tx->tx_msg.ksm_csum = csum;
00423 }
00424 
00425 int
00426 ksocknal_lib_get_conn_tunables (ksock_conn_t *conn, int *txmem, int *rxmem, int *nagle)
00427 {
00428         struct socket *sock = conn->ksnc_sock;
00429         int            len;
00430         int            rc;
00431 
00432         rc = ksocknal_connsock_addref(conn);
00433         if (rc != 0) {
00434                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_closing);
00435                 *txmem = *rxmem = *nagle = 0;
00436                 return (-ESHUTDOWN);
00437         }
00438 
00439         rc = lnet_sock_getbuf(sock, txmem, rxmem);
00440         if (rc == 0) {
00441                 len = sizeof(*nagle);
00442                 rc = kernel_getsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_NODELAY,
00443                                        (char *)nagle, &len);
00444         }
00445 
00446         ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
00447 
00448         if (rc == 0)
00449                 *nagle = !*nagle;
00450         else
00451                 *txmem = *rxmem = *nagle = 0;
00452 
00453         return (rc);
00454 }
00455 
00456 int
00457 ksocknal_lib_setup_sock (struct socket *sock)
00458 {
00459         int             rc;
00460         int             option;
00461         int             keep_idle;
00462         int             keep_intvl;
00463         int             keep_count;
00464         int             do_keepalive;
00465         struct linger   linger;
00466 
00467         sock->sk->sk_allocation = GFP_NOFS;
00468 
00469         /* Ensure this socket aborts active sends immediately when we close
00470          * it. */
00471 
00472         linger.l_onoff = 0;
00473         linger.l_linger = 0;
00474 
00475         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER,
00476                                (char *)&linger, sizeof(linger));
00477         if (rc != 0) {
00478                 CERROR ("Can't set SO_LINGER: %d\n", rc);
00479                 return (rc);
00480         }
00481 
00482         option = -1;
00483         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_LINGER2,
00484                                (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00485         if (rc != 0) {
00486                 CERROR ("Can't set SO_LINGER2: %d\n", rc);
00487                 return (rc);
00488         }
00489 
00490         if (!*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nagle) {
00491                 option = 1;
00492 
00493                 rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_NODELAY,
00494                                        (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00495                 if (rc != 0) {
00496                         CERROR ("Can't disable nagle: %d\n", rc);
00497                         return (rc);
00498                 }
00499         }
00500 
00501         rc = lnet_sock_setbuf(sock,
00502                               *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_tx_buffer_size,
00503                               *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_rx_buffer_size);
00504         if (rc != 0) {
00505                 CERROR ("Can't set buffer tx %d, rx %d buffers: %d\n",
00506                         *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_tx_buffer_size,
00507                         *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_rx_buffer_size, rc);
00508                 return (rc);
00509         }
00510 
00511 /* TCP_BACKOFF_* sockopt tunables unsupported in stock kernels */
00512 #ifdef SOCKNAL_BACKOFF
00513         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_backoff_init > 0) {
00514                 option = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_backoff_init;
00515 #ifdef SOCKNAL_BACKOFF_MS
00516                 option *= 1000;
00517 #endif
00518 
00519                 rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_BACKOFF_INIT,
00520                                        (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00521                 if (rc != 0) {
00522                         CERROR ("Can't set initial tcp backoff %d: %d\n",
00523                                 option, rc);
00524                         return (rc);
00525                 }
00526         }
00527 
00528         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_backoff_max > 0) {
00529                 option = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_backoff_max;
00530 #ifdef SOCKNAL_BACKOFF_MS
00531                 option *= 1000;
00532 #endif
00533 
00534                 rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_BACKOFF_MAX,
00535                                        (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00536                 if (rc != 0) {
00537                         CERROR ("Can't set maximum tcp backoff %d: %d\n",
00538                                 option, rc);
00539                         return (rc);
00540                 }
00541         }
00542 #endif
00543 
00544         /* snapshot tunables */
00545         keep_idle  = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_keepalive_idle;
00546         keep_count = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_keepalive_count;
00547         keep_intvl = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_keepalive_intvl;
00548 
00549         do_keepalive = (keep_idle > 0 && keep_count > 0 && keep_intvl > 0);
00550 
00551         option = (do_keepalive ? 1 : 0);
00552         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE,
00553                                (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00554         if (rc != 0) {
00555                 CERROR ("Can't set SO_KEEPALIVE: %d\n", rc);
00556                 return (rc);
00557         }
00558 
00559         if (!do_keepalive)
00560                 return (0);
00561 
00562         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_KEEPIDLE,
00563                                (char *)&keep_idle, sizeof(keep_idle));
00564         if (rc != 0) {
00565                 CERROR ("Can't set TCP_KEEPIDLE: %d\n", rc);
00566                 return (rc);
00567         }
00568 
00569         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_KEEPINTVL,
00570                                (char *)&keep_intvl, sizeof(keep_intvl));
00571         if (rc != 0) {
00572                 CERROR ("Can't set TCP_KEEPINTVL: %d\n", rc);
00573                 return (rc);
00574         }
00575 
00576         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_KEEPCNT,
00577                                (char *)&keep_count, sizeof(keep_count));
00578         if (rc != 0) {
00579                 CERROR ("Can't set TCP_KEEPCNT: %d\n", rc);
00580                 return (rc);
00581         }
00582 
00583         return (0);
00584 }
00585 
00586 void
00587 ksocknal_lib_push_conn (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00588 {
00589         struct sock    *sk;
00590         struct tcp_sock *tp;
00591         int             nonagle;
00592         int             val = 1;
00593         int             rc;
00594 
00595         rc = ksocknal_connsock_addref(conn);
00596         if (rc != 0)                            /* being shut down */
00597                 return;
00598 
00599         sk = conn->ksnc_sock->sk;
00600         tp = tcp_sk(sk);
00601 
00602         lock_sock (sk);
00603         nonagle = tp->nonagle;
00604         tp->nonagle = 1;
00605         release_sock (sk);
00606 
00607         rc = kernel_setsockopt(conn->ksnc_sock, SOL_TCP, TCP_NODELAY,
00608                                (char *)&val, sizeof(val));
00609         LASSERT (rc == 0);
00610 
00611         lock_sock (sk);
00612         tp->nonagle = nonagle;
00613         release_sock (sk);
00614 
00615         ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
00616 }
00617 
00618 extern void ksocknal_read_callback (ksock_conn_t *conn);
00619 extern void ksocknal_write_callback (ksock_conn_t *conn);
00620 /*
00621  * socket call back in Linux
00622  */
00623 static void
00624 #ifdef HAVE_SK_DATA_READY_ONE_ARG
00625 ksocknal_data_ready(struct sock *sk)
00626 #else
00627 ksocknal_data_ready(struct sock *sk, int n)
00628 #endif
00629 {
00630         ksock_conn_t  *conn;
00631         ENTRY;
00632 
00633         /* interleave correctly with closing sockets... */
00634         LASSERT(!in_irq());
00635         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00636 
00637         conn = sk->sk_user_data;
00638         if (conn == NULL) {     /* raced with ksocknal_terminate_conn */
00639                 LASSERT(sk->sk_data_ready != &ksocknal_data_ready);
00640 #ifdef HAVE_SK_DATA_READY_ONE_ARG
00641                 sk->sk_data_ready(sk);
00642 #else
00643                 sk->sk_data_ready(sk, n);
00644 #endif
00645         } else
00646                 ksocknal_read_callback(conn);
00647 
00648         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00649 
00650         EXIT;
00651 }
00652 
00653 static void
00654 ksocknal_write_space (struct sock *sk)
00655 {
00656         ksock_conn_t  *conn;
00657         int            wspace;
00658         int            min_wpace;
00659 
00660         /* interleave correctly with closing sockets... */
00661         LASSERT(!in_irq());
00662         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00663 
00664         conn = sk->sk_user_data;
00665         wspace = sk_stream_wspace(sk);
00666         min_wpace = sk_stream_min_wspace(sk);
00667 
00668         CDEBUG(D_NET, "sk %p wspace %d low water %d conn %p%s%s%s\n",
00669                sk, wspace, min_wpace, conn,
00670                (conn == NULL) ? "" : (conn->ksnc_tx_ready ?
00671                                       " ready" : " blocked"),
00672                (conn == NULL) ? "" : (conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled ?
00673                                       " scheduled" : " idle"),
00674                (conn == NULL) ? "" : (list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue) ?
00675                                       " empty" : " queued"));
00676 
00677         if (conn == NULL) {             /* raced with ksocknal_terminate_conn */
00678                 LASSERT (sk->sk_write_space != &ksocknal_write_space);
00679                 sk->sk_write_space (sk);
00680 
00681                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00682                 return;
00683         }
00684 
00685         if (wspace >= min_wpace) {              /* got enough space */
00686                 ksocknal_write_callback(conn);
00687 
00688                 /* Clear SOCK_NOSPACE _after_ ksocknal_write_callback so the
00689                  * ENOMEM check in ksocknal_transmit is race-free (think about
00690                  * it). */
00691 
00692                 clear_bit (SOCK_NOSPACE, &sk->sk_socket->flags);
00693         }
00694 
00695         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00696 }
00697 
00698 void
00699 ksocknal_lib_save_callback(struct socket *sock, ksock_conn_t *conn)
00700 {
00701         conn->ksnc_saved_data_ready = sock->sk->sk_data_ready;
00702         conn->ksnc_saved_write_space = sock->sk->sk_write_space;
00703 }
00704 
00705 void
00706 ksocknal_lib_set_callback(struct socket *sock,  ksock_conn_t *conn)
00707 {
00708         sock->sk->sk_user_data = conn;
00709         sock->sk->sk_data_ready = ksocknal_data_ready;
00710         sock->sk->sk_write_space = ksocknal_write_space;
00711         return;
00712 }
00713 
00714 void
00715 ksocknal_lib_reset_callback(struct socket *sock, ksock_conn_t *conn)
00716 {
00717         /* Remove conn's network callbacks.
00718          * NB I _have_ to restore the callback, rather than storing a noop,
00719          * since the socket could survive past this module being unloaded!! */
00720         sock->sk->sk_data_ready = conn->ksnc_saved_data_ready;
00721         sock->sk->sk_write_space = conn->ksnc_saved_write_space;
00722 
00723         /* A callback could be in progress already; they hold a read lock
00724          * on ksnd_global_lock (to serialise with me) and NOOP if
00725          * sk_user_data is NULL. */
00726         sock->sk->sk_user_data = NULL;
00727 
00728         return ;
00729 }
00730 
00731 int
00732 ksocknal_lib_memory_pressure(ksock_conn_t *conn)
00733 {
00734         int            rc = 0;
00735         ksock_sched_t *sched;
00736 
00737         sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
00738         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
00739 
00740         if (!test_bit(SOCK_NOSPACE, &conn->ksnc_sock->flags) &&
00741             !conn->ksnc_tx_ready) {
00742                 /* SOCK_NOSPACE is set when the socket fills
00743                  * and cleared in the write_space callback
00744                  * (which also sets ksnc_tx_ready).  If
00745                  * SOCK_NOSPACE and ksnc_tx_ready are BOTH
00746                  * zero, I didn't fill the socket and
00747                  * write_space won't reschedule me, so I
00748                  * return -ENOMEM to get my caller to retry
00749                  * after a timeout */
00750                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00751         }
00752 
00753         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
00754 
00755         return rc;
00756 }
